title.name: Title
notes: default format is 'Miley Cyrus (Billy Ray)
alt format is 'Angelina Jolie (Jon Voight)
other formats possible, as this is merely for display it's _data_ is elsewhere

_id.name: ID
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_owner.name: Owner
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_createdDate.name: Created Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_updatedDate.name: Updated Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

idPP.name: Primary Parent ID
idPP.source: WiX Velo by way of automated Parent Membership
idPP.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: in a sense this makes Family ID redundant, but still good to have Family ID so that it is its own thing
in geek talk, using the Family ID makes everything more 'extensible'
it is permissible, for this table, for this value to be 'INSTANTIATE'

jsonEnrollment.name: Enrollment JSON
jsonEnrollment.usage: this holds all the data about the Parent(s) and the Student and the current enrollment Enrollment
notes: the Holy Grail
this can be used to Enroll a Student programatically
at the outset, generating this record and actual enrollment will be two separate tasks with two spearate clicks
eventually, this will happen instantaneously
still two separate tasks, but done one after the other by code so it seems like one task

jsonCorollary.name: Corollary JSON
notes: since the enrollmentOJson is the Holy Grail, there needs to be a place for any number of additional datapoints
none at first so an empty object will be iserted
eventually, additional data that is not _intrinsic_ to the enrollmentJson, but is as yet unknown
there may come a time where the code harvesting the enrollmentJson is _so_ stable
...that we use this corollaryJson for true enrollment data, but for the sake of not entering a potential bug this is used
again, this offers nearly unlimited extensibility

jsonStatusNotes.name: Status Notes JSON
jsonStatusNotes.usage: discrete values to describe the status of the Enrollment
notes: PENDING
TODELETE
REJECTED
ESCALATED
ENROLLED
COMPLETED
GRADUATED
PASSED
FAILED
CANCELLED
WITHDRAWN
EXPELLED
(capitalized by convention)
of course, this can be anything
...but the idea a collection of one word values that succicntly capture the, well, Status
